frame.name: Cause_to_resume
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> acts so as to cause some process to begin again after an interruption or suspension.
<ex><fex name="Agent">The two countries</fex> <t>revived</t> <fex name="Process">diplomatic relations</fex> <fex name="Hiatus">after a lull of five years</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>A sentient being acts with the intention of causing a process to begin again. <ex><fex name="Agent">The driver</fex> <t>restarted</t> the truck after it stalled.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Process
FE.definition: <def-root>The process which begins again after a suspension.</def-root>

FE.name: Hiatus
FE.definition: <def-root>The period of time during which the process is suspended. <ex>The two countries <t>revived</t> <fex name="Process">diplomatic relations</fex> <fex name="Hiatus">after a lull of five years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the process is restarted. <ex>This state <t>reinstated</t> <fex name="Process">the death penalty</fex> <fex name="Time">in 1975</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that causes the process to resume. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes.
<ex><fex name="Cause">The spring rains</fex> <t>restarted</t> <fex name="Process">the flow of the stream</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Process</fen> to resume.
<ex>The two nations <t>revived</t> relations <fex name="pla">in Geneva</fex> during the latest round of talks.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The intentional act performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that results in the resumption of the <fen>Process</fen>.
<ex>He managed to <t>revive</t> the controversy <fex name="mea">by leaking the story to several tabloid magazines</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of the manner in which the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the resumption of the <fen>Process</fen>.
<ex>Japanese banks have been <fex name="man">rapidly</fex> <t>reviving</t> business activity.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration_of_final_state
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time for which the <fen>Process</fen> continues after being started by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>The project was <t>restarted</t> <fex name="dur">for several weeks</fex> before it was permanently abandoned.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: revive.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To cause to begin again after a period of inactivity.

lexUnit.name: restart.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to start again, after a period of inactivity.

lexUnit.name: reinstate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bring a process back into an active state.

lexUnit.name: resume.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause a process to begin again after a pause
